website_summaries.verdict: The Asus RT-N56U is arguably one of the best true dual-band 300Mbps home routers on the market.
pros: The stylish and compact Asus RT-N56U Dual-Band Gigabit Wireless-N Router offers stellar 5GHz performance, long range, and an intuitive Web interface.
Its storage feature is well designed
and it offers a convenient way to access data over the Internet
cons: The Asus RT-N56U's Web interface takes a long time to apply changes and the router doesn't support the new three-stream 450Mbps wireless speed

customer_reviews.title: Still Going After 7-8 Years
customer_reviews.text: dont feel like looking up when i exactly purchaed this but its been a good 7-8 years and still going stronger than most fo the junk out their today. This was when ASUS was still a good company right now their hit or miss but mostly miss their build quality and QC have went down hill in the past few years.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for almost 4 years
customer_reviews.text: Worked really well for almost 4 years -- now, it's doing the same thing that the other reviewers are talking about ... it just stops working and then needs to be reset (simply unplug then plug back in). It will then work fine for about 20 hours, then need to be reset again. I also tried a hard reset, but that didn't change anything. I'm switching to the RT-ACRH13, because I read a lot of reviews from people who upgraded to it from the N56U. Hopefully that one will last longer than this one did!
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Amazing router. Perfect.
customer_reviews.text: Just installed it today; disabled wireless on old router/modem combo, setup this one and got the everything rolling smoothly within minutes of opening. Wow - lightning fast results; definitely what the Dr. ordered because we've been having dozens of daily problems with our old modem/router combo (that cable company sends them out). This was the best investment we've made in a while. Everything in the house is connecting smoothly and nothing seems like its bogged down. Get one of these asap - or go for the newer versions if you're pushing the point, but this model is doing a fantastic job.
customer_reviews.author: Honest Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent router with support for multiple Xbox One consoles
customer_reviews.text: My old standby Linksys WRT54GS was still working fine, but with a flaw: Two Xbox One consoles could not connect to it without one of them ending up with a "strict" NAT type. After doing some Internet research, I found that this router is known to work with multiple Xbox Ones. After setting mine up, I can confirm that it does in fact grant an open NAT to two Xbox One consoles simultaneously. The speed and range of this router are awesome, setup is easy, and I'd definitely recommend this router to anyone looking for a new one, especially if they'll need to run multiple gaming consoles simultaneously.
customer_reviews.author: Commander Shepard

customer_reviews.title: Great router, great speed, no complaints
customer_reviews.text: I have owned this router for almost two years. It is still super fast and really reliable. I have never had to restart it because it failed. I have never lost a connection because of it failing. This thing is reliable. I reboot it here and there, but only because that’s a smart thing to do with any router (I think, right?). There might be better ones on the market by now since it is at least two years old; I haven’t looked at routers since I bought this one so I wouldn’t know. I just wanted to provide a review that mentioned how well it has performed over time. I’d highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: J. Holston

customer_reviews.title: Six years without a single issue and still going strong
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in 2011 for $140 and I am still using it 6 years later without a single issue. We are a heavy bandwith usage family. 2 kids with Ipads multiple game systems (ps3, ps4, wiiu), 4 smart tvs, etc and it performs flawlessly. I can still stay connected 4 houses down the block while waiting at the kids bus stop. In the past six years I dont recall having to reboot it once.
customer_reviews.author: JohnnyRed

customer_reviews.title: Great router!
customer_reviews.text: This router works very well! I bought a netgear router but i only got half of my download speed. They said it was because routers only did half duplex over wifi. Well with this router I get my full advertised download speed. The only negatives are that the range is not as great as I hoped. I have it on the mantle in the corner of my house and I can't get good internet in the opposite corner upstairs of a 2200sqft house. Pros: Easy to setup Doesn't degrade the signal Nice industrial design Cons: Range isn't so great with my setup Gets very warm which will probably limit the life of the product.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Strong

customer_reviews.title: Worked great ... For a while
customer_reviews.text: I replaced an old Linksys router (that had started to identify itself as a PC) with this Asus router. Installation was easy, and the speed and range was really good. That Asus router failed after one week. Amazon was fantastic about sending a replacement right away, and the new one was just as simple to install, and effective. Unfortunately, after less than 3 months, the new one started losing connection (had to reset the cable router three times one Sunday morning, then it stopped connecting at all.) I reinstalled the old Linksys, and it worked steadily. Ended up getting a newer Linksys, and giving up on the Asus product.
customer_reviews.author: Mike S

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Router!
customer_reviews.text: This Asus wireless router is a must have and for the price in comparison to other wireless routers on the market it pretty much sells itself! The user interface/web interface for all general settings and admin information is really easy as to use as well. The blue lights in my opinion are a nice addition and a selling feature versus the old school generic red and/or yellow blinky lights! This router isn't, too bulky, very light and there's not additional antenna that you have to adjust accordingly and can be hidden behind a picture frame easily; that is if your concerned on location of the router in your home to transmit the best wireless signals!
customer_reviews.author: J. Edwards, Jr

customer_reviews.title: Asus customer service is terrible, and the product broke after two months of ...
customer_reviews.text: Asus customer service is terrible, and the product broke after two months of use (it no longer turns on). They requested that I send it to them, wait one to two weeks for them to repair it, and they will send it back. They refused to ship a replacement router any sooner. When I asked what they suggested I do about my lack of wireless internet for two weeks, they suggested that I buy a second router. They refused my request for a refund. The product was bad, the customer service was worse.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Armiger

customer_reviews.title: Works great, but tech support...
customer_reviews.text: It took 2 minutes to set this thing up. Amazing process, and the way it should be. Once I connected our USB network drive, it stopped working! I spent a lot of time w/ tech support, and then I finally figured out it's getting interference from the drive. I moved them apart, and presto! Works perfectly. It took way too long to get to that point, and I wish tech support had told me that. Also, I cannot figure out how to set up security on the FTP share. Again, tech support did not know how to do that. All in all, the speed on this device is fantastic. Huge upgrade from my 1-yr old Linksys n-router.
customer_reviews.author: D. Newman

customer_reviews.title: Excellent router.
customer_reviews.text: I finally settled on this one after reading countless reviews. I also bought a Motorola SURFboard DOCSIS 3.0 modem and the combination has been great. Comparing side by side with the rental combo modem/router from Comcast on my 50mbps connection: I got 12mbps using the rental and 15 minutes later after setting this up I was getting nearly 40mbps over the 5G Wi-Fi band! It's extremely simple to set up and password protect, and I especially like the disk management feature which allows me to keep a USB drive plugged into it for extra network storage. Still haven't found a great solution for automatic network backup but I'm sure it's out there. Plus, it looks cool.
customer_reviews.author: Dan A.

customer_reviews.title: Worst router I ever owned
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the ASUS RT-N56U because of reviews I read and that I figured Asus was a good company (I have owned their motherboards for years). This router has had problems from day 1. I had 3 support tickets while it was in warranty, and the company would not replace it. Now it fails every month or two, and I have to completely reset the thing and spend days trying to get it to work correctly again. I have owned some really cheap routers in the past, and they worked much better than this router. I am guessing I just got a bad router, but Asus would not replace it, so I will not buy another one.
customer_reviews.author: Ty

customer_reviews.title: Very frustrating and not really worth the money
customer_reviews.text: This was a very frustrating piece of equipment. It barely works without flashing the firmware. When you do flash the firmware, be sure to reset back to factory defaults because it will not function right until you do. I spent hours trying to get this to work! The Samba/SMB/Windows Network function still does not work. The FTP feature is abysmally slow! The printer function does work, however, and works well. The media feature works mostly, as in, it shows up on the network every other reboot. I am a bit disappointed, but, when it does work, it is kinda neat. If everything worked and was easier to setup, it would be a 5 star.
customer_reviews.author: khoward

customer_reviews.title: Not as stable as I'd hoped...
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for this router...and I liked the design of its configuration menus. However, the firmware (even the latest from the web site) is buggy. I wound up having to boot it at least once a day. I finally gave up and replaced it with a, which is an older design, but a classic. With the Linksys, we're MUCH happier, even though it's just an A/B/G router, and it doesn't have the 5gHz band. I haven't had to boot it in 2 months. No one in my home misses the Asus at all.
customer_reviews.author: Mike L

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous Wreless Router
customer_reviews.text: Fabulous wireless router. I had recently replaced my existing Athero WiFi card in a Asus G75VW laptop with the Intel 6235 WiFi card to give me both N-bands and doubled download speed from 72.2 to 144mbps. I then installed the Asus wireless router and was floored with its capability. I was now looking at download speeds of over 200 to 400mbps. It has a great GUI, very professional and easily understood. Backing up the original firmware and preference was a breeze. Upgrading to the latest firmware was simple and installed with no problems. The router is located in my office and transmit/receives through two wall, 66 feet to my family room with zero drop offs and strong signal.
customer_reviews.author: Relaxng

customer_reviews.title: its not a bad router but placement is crucial
customer_reviews.text: its not a bad router but placement is crucial....center of the house ...yes but in my sitch its in my bedroom far end of the house so on one side outside i get a good but not great wi-fi on the opposing end of my house there's nothing wi-fi, i guess i'll need a repeater, but for the money its great if you locate it centrally in your house, runs cool! i have had to move it to different angles on my computer desk to get optimum signals as its a internal antenna router....i gave it 3 stars for this reason! I use it with my motorola surfboard modem 3.0 high speed and it mates well!
customer_reviews.author: proman

customer_reviews.title: Great router!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great router. Had this model and it served me well for a long time. It finally died, and I ordered a new router. I went with a netgear..... all I can say, is that the netgear wasn’t even in the same ballpark as far as performance goes. Netgear did not have the range; was subject to signal loss and drop outs. I returned it a few days later. I went back and reordered the same model of ASUS router that I had previously. Got it today and hooked it up. Unbelievable difference in speed and range of signal. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: wr

customer_reviews.title: Excellent router
customer_reviews.text: I just got this yesterday, hooked it up in ten minutes, and am totally satisfied (so far). I bought it because the previous (Comcast-provided) router could not even reach my TiVo unit that is on the same floor and probably 30 feet (and two walls) away. The annoying TiVo message that I had been getting for weeks ("No internet connection") disappeared immediately. My son, who is a big-time gamer, said there's been a big improvement in both the speed and the reliability of the signal (no game crashes so far). I bought this based largely on the many positive reviews. I'm glad I listened to them!
customer_reviews.author: Bill in Visalia, CA

customer_reviews.title: Set up on this router is not easy if you are a typical homeowner non-tech person
customer_reviews.text: Set up on this router is not easy if you are a typical homeowner non-tech person. 8 support phone calls later, after several hours and a firmware crash (do not update the firmware on this router) and returning the product and waiting for a replacement, it is finally up and running. So far seems fast and doing what it is supposed to do. Strong signal, fast. But while the support operators around the world did their best, the language barrier is very frustrating. Long wait for support on Saturdays...
customer_reviews.author: John E. Jacobsen

customer_reviews.title: Simply the best
customer_reviews.text: There is a reason this is still considered one of if not the best router available. It just works! It's stable and strong, it works on 2.4 and 5g bands which is nice. I recently upgraded to the iPhone 5s and a Nexus 10 tablet. Both connect to the 5G band and are screaming fast while connected there. Don't let the price scare you off. Prior to purchasing this I had connectivity issues constantly. With the upgrade to this ASUS product my connectivity issues are a thing of the past. I highly recommend it. Cons: I hate the base mount. If you have the space to use it laying flat rather than on the mount I would suggest that.
customer_reviews.author: Kody A.

customer_reviews.title: Def a bit disappointed in the area coverage/range
customer_reviews.text: Def a bit disappointed in the area coverage/range...the speed it gives is lot better than our cable modems wifi but the range is no better if not worse...really thot by the description it would reach everywhere in my house which is just a small ranch house...only goes to abut 100 feet...2 rooms over from the router barely gets any bars...but when it does...the speed is good tho...but it will NOT reach evreywhere in your house like it says.
customer_reviews.author: G. Hofmann

customer_reviews.title: Setting up a wireless N-router was never a nightmare BEFORE ...
customer_reviews.text: Setting up a wireless N-router was never a nightmare BEFORE; then I purchased the ASUS RT-N56U. I downloaded ASUS firmware, or patches, and spent a WEEK trying to establish a connection - to no avail. Then I PAID the cable company to send out a technician. After one hour, he produced the same result. His parting comment, "It's the router's software." I quite agree. As for the star rating, there should be a different symbol for companies that STOP supporting their own products.
customer_reviews.author: B Adkins

customer_reviews.title: A Good Router
customer_reviews.text: Changed to this router about a year ago. Today is 09/2013. It does a good job operating 2 PC's, a pad, Roku and a phone. It's located in my basement but provides good service for the devices used upstairs (3). It used to be a little sketchy with some of the upstairs devices but when I upgraded the downstairs pc to IMac, the routers performance was noticeably better. I don't think this is the best router available but for the price, I find it to serve my needs. If you care about aesthetics, it looks kinda cool and doesn't take up much desk top. It's neither flimsy nor sturdy. HEF
customer_reviews.author: Evaluator

customer_reviews.title: It's not bad, but not good
customer_reviews.text: I had this router for a few years and it worked well enough. I had issues where it would get really hot and it'd lose connection once a week. After doing a restart and unplugging it'd run fine for another week or so, but then I'd have to go through the reset process. It then started resetting itself completely, losing all saved data and settings. I would re-enter in the user and password information and all of my settings multiple times a week. I finally tossed it out and replaced it with a Netgear Nighthawk and it works amazingly, but that's for another review.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Chunn

customer_reviews.title: Ok but.....
customer_reviews.text: My old reliable D-Link Dir 655 finally gave out so after reading a lot of reviews I settled on this one. While my download speed has increased 3 fold the range is much less than the 655. Installation was confusing as all my devices are wireless already. I do like the look of it. I will keep is as I picked it up for a good price but I must admit it has not meet my expecitations. If I would have bought it locally I would be exchanging it, this is the downside of an on line purchase. If you are upgrading or replacing a router I would recommend trying some other model than this one. Your mileage my vary.
customer_reviews.author: mmv

customer_reviews.title: Great router!
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazingly good router at a great price! I like the "upright" form factor, and I especially like the included firmware. Usually I'm itching to install DD-WRT or other similar "third party" firmware after a few days, but this included firmware does everything I want to do, so I give a great commendation to Asus for their software! Regarding speed, it seems to be plenty fast enough, and doesn't introduce undue latency into my games or work. Time will tell if it lasts. Consumer routers seem to have a finite lifespan, unfortunately.
customer_reviews.author: Damian Harouff

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy it if you are using Apple product
customer_reviews.text: This router has a good range, but that's it for me. The router keeps logging errors like "kernel: Qidx(0), not enough space in MgmtRing, MgmtRingFullCount=168!", and then will not responds for several minutes at least. I had to reboot it several times a day to use it. Last weekend I spent sometime to locate the problem by connecting my devices one at a time, and found out that this router has problem with Apple products. Even flashed a custom firmware won't help. I will return this one. Give two stars just for the excellent range.
customer_reviews.author: penpal

customer_reviews.title: Easy set up and flawless connection
customer_reviews.text: I cannot speak about this in terms of longevity, but so far it has been a real blessing. I just moved into my first apartment so this is the first time I had to purchase a router and set it up on my own. This was ridiculously easy to set up. When I first moved in, I purchased a TP link 20 dollar router. We have about 5 devices and after the first day, only my mac connected.This flawlessly connect to my mac, note 4, iphone, dell, and kindle fire.
customer_reviews.author: halcyon17

customer_reviews.title: Great at first...
customer_reviews.text: At first I was very happy with my purchase and glad to know that ASUS has been a beacon of great performance with reasonable prices. However, a year later, the 2.4Ghz signal no longer works and now resort to using the 7+ year old router that the ASUS was supposed to replace to handle the 2.4Ghz only devices. A lot of troubleshooting time has been wasted because of this.
customer_reviews.author: randen

customer_reviews.title: Good looking router with even better performance.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this thing for about 2 years now, and it's pretty much awesome. I've had to restart it maybe once or twice in the 2 years I've owned it, and even then it probably wasn't the router that was the problem. I always have a strong signal, even when I'm farther away from the router. Never drops me or really has any issues at all. Configuration is easy and there are advanced configurations for power users, but the defaults work well enough with minimal setup effort. And it looks pretty good, so that's a plus.
customer_reviews.author: Danimal

customer_reviews.title: Brick
customer_reviews.text: Unboxed this and entered setup, the router said it needed an firmware update, I said ok and it downloaded and installed automatically, then the router would not power back on after restarting. I called support and it turned out the router/update bricked itself. I was given a link to a youtube video (ironically since I didnt have a functioning wireless connection) which walked me through a manual firmware restore. So the router worked for about 2 weeks after that then it decided to no longer accept an internet connection from the modem. Power cycled, factory reset, nothing worked. Ive decided to get a replacement hoping I just got a lemon. Will see how that goes.
customer_reviews.author: Falcore

customer_reviews.title: This is a stable and fast router
customer_reviews.text: I have owned several wireless routers from US Robotics (2 different models) D-Link and now this ASUS. This router is by far the most stable and easy to use. I did upgrade the firmware right out of the box and ran into a minor issue with that process but it was my error and not the error of the unit. I recommend you follow the ASUS instruction and on-screen prompts exactly to prevent frustration. My previous routers had trouble disconnecting and going off-line often. This one is very stable. I am never dropped on any of the devices we have in the house. I highly recommend ASUS routers for fast, trouble-free service.
customer_reviews.author: SBCinClayton

customer_reviews.title: Never received rebate.
customer_reviews.text: Router works fine but ASUS never provided the $20 rebate and it has been well over two months since the purchase. I did get a rebate tracking number that allowed me to confirm that ASUS received all of the required paperwork: 12/12/2016 2:56:43 PM Claim Created 12/12/2016 2:57:25 PM Claim Completed, Awaiting Receipt of Documentation 12/26/2016 6:47:15 AM Documentation Received View Original Documentation 12/31/2016 7:20:03 AM Approved
customer_reviews.author: KyloZeus

customer_reviews.title: Exceeded my expectations
customer_reviews.text: Ok so my dad has this linksys e4200 cisco router and it was alright except at random moments the signal would drop and not work. Other times it would be extremely slow and not load pages correctly. So I bought this router used on Amazon and man is this thing a beast. Apparently its like a gaming router because once I upgraded the software it had options like Ddos protection and stuff and I never thought a router could do that. Anyway im just happy that the signal is fast and it is still good in my backyard no connection problems with the distance or anything. (:
customer_reviews.author: h00diie

customer_reviews.title: Best Router For The Price
customer_reviews.text: I was having numerous issues connecting my Chromebook to my router. After reading about Chromebooks connecting to 5 GHz much better, I decided to purchase this dual band. At first I was having some major problems, but after going through troubleshooting with support, I was finally able to hash out problems I was having with my two older Windows computers. The router has great features through its own software that allows you to customize each channel. It has been great for our household, allowing the closer electronics to run on the 5 GHz band, and connect to the 2.4 GHZ band when we are further from the router.
customer_reviews.author: JoinThe1

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed - nothing lasts over a year anymore.
customer_reviews.text: This router worked AMAZINGLY until a year after this purchase it began to drop connectivity intermittently. As a person who works from home, this is a little piece of hell for me. I've called support 3 times thus far, and nothing has worked. It's so disappointing that nothing lasts over a year nowadays. I had the exact thing happen to a minifridge that I purchased a year ago and now that's defunct. I was really rooting that Asus still kept the quality they've been known for, and was hoping this router would get me through the next 5 years at least so I can stop buying Linksys every year... They definitely fell short on this one.
customer_reviews.author: Alex F

customer_reviews.title: Marginal at best...
customer_reviews.text: There has to be better out there. This is a marginal router - very temperamental. Some days are OK, most...not so much. VoIP quality is hit or miss, mostly miss. DHCP services seem to have a limit on how many devices it doles out IPs to. Seems like I need to restart the router at least weekly. Performance is marginal, good chance you'll be needing a repeater for coverage. If you're in the market for a sub-par, milquetoast wifi router that's needy, this is your router.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Happy With Our Wifi, but only for 4 months
customer_reviews.text: There are plenty of great technical reviews for this product, which prompted me to purchase it to replace our old linksys. Connectivity is great with the new ASUS, and I'm happy to report the League of Legends (online game) players are all happy. We use wifi for multiple computers, our printer, streaming videos, etc. All good. Update. April 2013, about 4 months into our Asus relationship it all went to Tartarus. Constantly resetting the IP, setting static IP, downloading new firmware, etc. etc. Nothing worked and I was in net withdrawl for days. Currently just renting a router from my internet provider. Adieu Asus. You sure were purty. Quel dommage.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Y_C2QIzeUP0&feature=youtu.be  Video Review
customer_reviews.text: So far i have no problem my speeds have increased from 12 Mbps to almost 50 . Its a 5 GHz router so there is no wave interference with other Wi-Fi devices in the building because not many people have 5 GHz routers most still have 2.4. Be aware that not all devices are compatible but most windows 8 Laptops are and some windows 7 but if the device is not compatible you can run in on 2.4 it gives you options when you connect . Installation was pretty simple Video Review
customer_reviews.author: brsrafal

customer_reviews.title: Great Router!
customer_reviews.text: Works extremely well and very inexpensive. Has great range and very good stable connection. Would recommend this to someone who has very little bandwidth needs like parents or grandparents. If you have more then 4 or so people go with a bigger router as you will run into slow downs as it will not take long to max out the bandwidth on this with multiple devices. All in all though a great router and an awesome company with great customer support when needed.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony W.

customer_reviews.title: Looks sleeker and faster than it is
customer_reviews.text: The reason I bought this was to get a stronger signal throughout the house than the one Comcast provided with our service. Turns out the Comcast unit was pretty good after all. This one provides about the same signal strength and speed as the old one on the 2GHz setting and a little faster with the 5GHz. Only problem is that the 5GHz signal drops off significantly when I leave the room where it's located, so I use the 2GHz setting most of the time. I'm a bit disappointed, but it does save me the $3 a month rental fee. By the time it pays for itself it will be long obsolete.
customer_reviews.author: M. Dees

customer_reviews.title: Good Buy!
customer_reviews.text: The signal on this reaches my room really well, which is probably about 40-50 feet away from the cable modem. I bought it because I was getting a scant 10Mbps from the modem's wifi. With the ASUS I'm getting over 100. I didn't have to do much set up either. I unplugged the modem, plugged in the router, connected the Ethernet, and plugged the modem back in after a couple minutes and boom! It actually boosted my existing network, so I didn't have to worry about setting up a new one. Pretty user friendly, and very good performance!
customer_reviews.author: Decoratin4Fun!

customer_reviews.title: To Asus
customer_reviews.text: Hello Asus, If you are following these comments, here's a clue you can use fixing the RT-56U connection drop problem: Unfortunately, the WAN connection is still dropped from time to time even with the newest firmware (3.0.0.4.374_979). I have found a strong correlation between T4 timeout occurring on the DOCSIS modem and RT-56U losing WAN connection. When T4 timeout occurs, cable modem reboots (standard behavior), and this inadvertent reboot seems to be causing a confusion on RT-56U. Hope this helps you fix the issue of this otherwise great router.
customer_reviews.author: MU

customer_reviews.title: Possibly the best router ever
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this ASUS Router in May 2011, after 1.5 years, it's still going strong, works perfectly. I've gone through many routers in the past, d-link, netgear, linksys, cisco, you name it, I have tried it. I don't know if it's my luck or what, routers always act up, dropped connection, slowness or just plain stopped working (a linksys router). This ASUS router has worked perfectly since day one, and continues to work perfectly after 1.5 years. I have grown to really respect ASUS products, always high quality, keep up the good job ASUS! Update 2017-07-30: still going strong, no problem at all. Asus you created a monster!
customer_reviews.author: KoKo

customer_reviews.title: Had this for several years - Update - now had this for 8 years - Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to not pay Comcast for their router. 8 years on, we've had no problems. A number of people criticize the software, but I've found this much, much easier to work with than other routers I've used. Routers are technical, but with an ability to google you can figure these things out. I've only had two issues over the past several years. One was fixed by restarting the router - that was it. Just now I had to turn on UPNP for media streaming - easy as pie. It's been a very good product.
customer_reviews.author: James T. Barringer

customer_reviews.title: We only use this router for about a month when ...
customer_reviews.text: We only use this router for about a month when we switched internet service providers and they insisted we use only their router for our system I'm sure I could add a second one but I would just soon use switches instead of more routers.
customer_reviews.author: Consumer122112

customer_reviews.title: Best Wireless Router Ever?
customer_reviews.text: If you have ever had a miserable experience in setting up a wireless router only to find out that all you gained was mediocre performance, take heart. The ASUS RT-N56U wireless router is not only easy to set up, it works better than any router I have ever used in the past. Feature filled, latest technology, strong signal strength through a solid floor and no dropouts. In fact, the DSL speed on my primary (non-wireless) computer seems to be faster than before!! Did I mention that my wife loves it? As with any wireless router,make sure you pay attention to your security settings. Great product and well worth the small premium you have to pay.
customer_reviews.author: bensonjon

customer_reviews.title: ASUS strikes again!
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded from my trusted D-link router to this Asus model on reputation and experience with Asus mother boards and my Asus G73JH gaming powerhouse laptop. This router has excellent range, settings, and prioritizing network bandwith is a huge plus. The option to give video games a higher priority than casual surfing is a great advantage and seems to be working thus far. The only design feature i do not like is the location of the cable inputs. They are on the side of the device, and when using the upright stand the lan and power cables are sticking out the side. Not a huge deal, but also not perfect. Overall excellent router, design, features, and stability.
customer_reviews.author: Timr

customer_reviews.title: Mac users beware firmware upgrade!
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to receive this because the reviews are so favorable. I installed it successfully and was then prompted to upgrade the firmware, then restart the router. I did, and the router wouldn't connect. The power light just kept flashing. I called customer support, and I have to connect the router to a PC in order to download the rescue file, or something. I'll have to bring home a PC laptop from work to finish troubleshooting - and this is right out of the box! Very annoying that I can't connect to my fancy new router tonight.
customer_reviews.author: Cat Overman

customer_reviews.title: Failed within a month
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice router with a lot of features, but I apparently got a lemon. It repeatedly stops responding; can't ping it, can't surf, no DHCP. Cycle the power and when it comes up it acts like it's never been configured, yet still has my wireless name and DNS settings. Might work for 20 minutes, then it does it again. Luckily I'm within 2 days of Amazon's return policy so I'm getting it replaced. It gets wicked hot so maybe that's why. My other minor complaint, is that when a USB drive is connected, it never lets the drive go into standby. It's constantly accessing it so the drive never sleeps.
customer_reviews.author: Kiran Otter

customer_reviews.title: Simple port forwarding
customer_reviews.text: Great router for gaming and port forwarding. Simple to understand interface and you can name each port forward to keep track of which game goes to which port. The WiFi is fine though I rarely use that aspect of the router. Edit: 11/6/2015 Going strong and currently supporting the ports for five games. I also now use the WiFi aspect of this router regularly and it can handle a heavy load without fail. Comcast raised my internet speed from 16g to 80g and this router handled it easily. Great router!
customer_reviews.author: L. Savage

customer_reviews.title: Features, performance, easy setup = best 'bang' for your buck
customer_reviews.text: Looking to replace my failing Netgear WNR3500L wireless router, I was torn between this router and the D-Link DIR-860L. But, just when I was about to decide on the D-Link, it was out-of-stock. Needing a quick replacement, I turned to the ASUS, and I couldn't be happier with that choice. The hardware features/specs speak for themselves, but I was also impressed with the ability to act as a print server to my Brother laser printer, which is not well supported by third-party print servers. The setup instructions got my printer up and running in minutes. Want a wireless router with excellent performance, advanced features, easy setup, and at a competitive price? Look no further than the ASUS RT-N56U.
customer_reviews.author: Robert M. Boyd

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: My Linksys router died after 5yrs of usage. Probably because I dropped it a few times when I moved and left in the hot sun a few times. Anyway decided to buy this one and amazed how easy to set it up without any hassle. I have windows 7. PC ON. Plug in ASUS router. Plug in Cable Modem to ASUS router. Plug in ASUS router to PC. ->input router name and password Instant connection! Iphone ON Go to IPhone setting, search router name and password Instant connection! Laptop ON Search for router name, enter password Instant connection! Love it and no problem! hope it lasts!
customer_reviews.author: D. T.

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good for what I needed.
customer_reviews.text: This router is the least expensive one that I have purchased. Normally I purchase the lastest and newest devices out on the market, but I just needed a simple router for the house now that the kids have left and the demand for bandwidth is less. Out where we live, our max Internet speed is 7 MBS due to our ISP. With the limitations on bandwidth, this device does pretty good. It manages 2 phones, 4 tablets, two computers, PS4, Smart TV and 2 printers. And does a good job
customer_reviews.author: Mad_Dog

customer_reviews.title: Wireless dream
customer_reviews.text: Love love love after upgrading from surfboard. Dual band helps differentiate between devices that prefer one over the other. I can stream movies without interruption with HD quality. Of course internet speed has everything to do with it but this wiress device makes it so much easier. The controls are also very easy to access with easy to read instructions on how to change passwords and identify which broadband to access.
customer_reviews.author: Steph

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for about 2 years
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this router in April 2012, and was extremely happy with it until this month. I have my main desktop PC connected via Ethernet cable, a laptop using wifi, and a Blu-ray player also using wifi for streaming music and Netflix movies. All worked flawlessly with this router for the first 2 years or so. But recently, this router has started to drop internet connection, requiring power off/on, then works fine until the next time. 3 reboots so far today. I will be looking for a new router, but don't know which brand is reliable. My past experiences with Link-sys and D-link have been worse than with this Asus.
customer_reviews.author: Mooseman

customer_reviews.title: Works, but horrible interface if you need to troubleshoot. May as well be a dumb device just about.
customer_reviews.text: Works, routes, shares a hard drive fine. If you're having any issues on your network though, it's interface is horrid. It usually shows one or two devices connected rather than the 6 I have (some on a switch off of it), no easy way to see what wireless devices are connected. Overall, very poor interface if you're trying to troubleshoot anything. I'm not sure if they're more recent devices have better interface, don't think I care to try again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My household is fortunate enough to be in a ComCast "BLAST" zone
customer_reviews.text: decided to not pay the monthly leasing fee for ComCast. picked this up with the Motorola SB66121 surfboard for about 2/3rd the cost of the lease over a 2 year span (which is my contract period). My household is fortunate enough to be in a ComCast "BLAST" zone..which means 105mbs capability down and 20 up. This router runs multiple tablets, laptops and cell phones with no noticeable lag on any of the items being used. We typically get 30mbs on our tablets. Could be happier and the setup was a breeze.
customer_reviews.author: MTate

customer_reviews.title: Best Router I've ever had (Super Fast / Never Freezes or Times Out) Slow Mobile iPhone iOS connections
customer_reviews.text: This works great for everything I use it for. It's fast, it never freezes and it never times out. My old router I had to reset daily as it lost the connection to the cable modem. The only thing this has problems with is the iPhone iOS 5s connection. My iPhone connects to it and it seems to go slow and not work right. I often have to turn off the wifi on my iPhone to get a connection and the WiFi on my iPhone 5s to this just seems to not work. It works for everything else great. The laptop and printer and Roku, it's just the iPhone 5s that seems to have issues with the connection.
customer_reviews.author: Toolman TimTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: This router offers some awesome features for a decent price
customer_reviews.text: This router offers some awesome features for a decent price, but be earned that there are STILL firmware issues with the router. I've had to completely start over with it no fewer than three times so far. I suspect that my issues may have to do with the software it loaded onto my USB storage, but I can't be certain. Even with those issues though, this router has changed the way that I stream media to my PC, and will put up with the minor hassles for the other 95% of the time when it works fantastic with Google Chrome.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Francis

customer_reviews.title: great modem
customer_reviews.text: Excellent modem. We have a 4000 sq ft home and it covers all of it. It is on first floor and covers both first and second. Will buy it again, if it dies.Did quite a bit of research and reading reviews before buying this one about 3 years ago.
customer_reviews.author: HJMW-IL-PR

customer_reviews.title: I regret buying it
customer_reviews.text: Set up was fairly simple and the software is straight forward enough for amateur users BUT the problems encountered after install were anything but simple. I constantly lose internet connection through ethernet connection and wifi to my laptop (yup I can't stream Netflix through the laptop). Asus customer support was so pointless with their suggestions that I went to the internet to try and solve the problem - no luck. I hate the router and it's too late to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Dezi Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Does very well, but could be a little better
customer_reviews.text: Router came in time, installed easily enough, and performs fairly well. Installed in a 1,900 sf house, signal reaches to all 4 outside corners, and throughout most of my lawn outside. However, after a distance of about 200 ft out or so the signal strength dramatically drops from full bars to 1-2 bars and becomes nearly impossible to work with. Weaker devices have trouble picking up signal from this router and sometimes have to be restarted several times before connection is made.
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: Awesome so far!
customer_reviews.text: I've tried the following wireless routers: Cisco E2500, E3200, E4200V2. None of these could even come close to the range/performance of the ASUS RT-N56U. I have a wood-frame house, and the Cisco signal would die off in my bedroom, just over 40 feet away. With the ASUS.. I'm able to stay connected across the street! There is a custom ASUS firmware available from padavan (google it). ASUS makes their source code available for download, this makes it much easier for devs to make custom firmware (unlike other manufacturers). I'd recommend this to anyone who games and plays HD video. It's been rock solid as well, no reboots needed!
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: After a couple years use this still works very well ...
customer_reviews.text: After a couple years use this still works very well. In the 2 years I've had it, I've had to reboot this thing no more than a few times. Would give it a 5*, but the print server on it really, really is lacking. printer server drops the printer every now and then. I'd have to then go into the online and restart the print server.
customer_reviews.author: C. Yang

customer_reviews.title: FIVE STAR PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: This unit replaced at older, slower router. Very fast, easy to connect without the CD - the only comment would be that the base is some kind of rubber that Velcro won't stick to. When a router is in operation with the cables attached, it's hard to keep it upright. I used velcro to stick the old router to the top of my box computer but the material on the ASUS base prohibits the adhevise side of the velcro to stick.
customer_reviews.author: LEE

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: It's been working great with a big improvement in performance over my old Linksys. I had an old WRT 54G and once I updated to this router my speed increases and was more constant. Setup was fairly easy, though I did need to update the firmware, but that was Jo big deal. I took the time to get it setup right to be sure if gets e best performance.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Good for a while, thenit just dies!
customer_reviews.text: Was a really good router for a while... I installed this in March of 2012 and it worked like a charm, for about two years. Then I had to keep resetting it. At first a reset lasted for a week or so. Finally I was resetting two or three times to stream a movie. For $130.00 I had visions of keeping this until it was not technically sufficient. I think it is a crime that this did not last until then! In all good conscious, I could not recommend this to anyone
customer_reviews.author: JWBennett

customer_reviews.title: A stylish powerhouse with a slew of features.
customer_reviews.text: I've typically used Linksys devices by Cisco for my home networking but this time I decided to try the ASUS N 600 because of a recommendation from a friend. It is one decision I will not regret and the router is worth every penny. It's fast, capable, and has a slew of features to include turning any external HDD into a NAS. The router's configuration interface has all the options for those with some home networking knowhow for management needs but also has some built in wizards to aid less technical users. My new favorite router!
customer_reviews.author: Lacheisis

customer_reviews.title: Two channels are better than one :)
customer_reviews.text: Pretty. Easy to set up. Works consistently. Great to have two channels because the 5.0 is fast but does not reach around corners or through walls..... The 2.4 is fast enough and reaches everywhere in our long house and outdoors to work across the street on the lawn :)
customer_reviews.author: Altadenamom

customer_reviews.title: Good Router. Set-up harder than anticipated.
customer_reviews.text: I had some issues setting this up through my Apple iMac. The instructions for Apple install did not match my computer at all. Online tech support was out of the question since I had no router, so I had to call Asus for support, and we were able to figure it out. Once it was working, it was great. Have been using continuously for several months. We have 3-4 computers, 4 tablets, 2 phones, an xbox and a Roku pulling & have only had to reset it once.
customer_reviews.author: JuleE

customer_reviews.title: Best Electronic Product I've Purchased ...including my Laptop!
customer_reviews.text: I originally purchased this router to replace the belkin router supplied by the Internet provider. I kept having to reboot the router continually sometimes several times a day. Finally I said F**K this in the teeth!!! AFter reading several online reviews of this and other routers, I took the plunge although for some reason I was skeptical of ASUS. I don't know why, I just was. This is one of the best products money can buy. The setup and initialization were unbelievably simple and easy. It has continued to work flawlessly for several months.
customer_reviews.author: James T. Engle, Jr.

customer_reviews.title: elegant, simple & stable
customer_reviews.text: i needed something that was user friendly and stable. my linksys router was acting up a lot (i had to reset the router every other day) can't believe how thin this asus router is ... i'm so used to huge boxy routers. it looks very nice too, i don't have to worry about hiding it out of sight. it took me 10min to set up, connected my pc, imac and macbook pro without a hitch. after a few months continual use i've yet to encounter any problems or a reason to reset it. my friends have easily been able to connect their iphones, ipads, etc whenever they visit. best router i've owned!
customer_reviews.author: zoezo

customer_reviews.title: After two months use the router constantly drops signal.  Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this router after receiving the TG862G-CT modem/router that did not work. Research indicated an all in one is not the best option. I installed this with ease. It is working great for me. No Comcast issues. I also ordered the Arris TM822G TouchstoneÂ® DOCSIS 3.0 8x4 Ultra-High Speed Telephony Modem to round out my network. It is operating flawlessly also. I would recommend both of these products especially if you have Comcast and want to eliminate the monthly modem/router rental fee.
customer_reviews.author: Lee E. Sowers

customer_reviews.title: Far superior to most routers
customer_reviews.text: This router was pretty easy to setup and the performance has been nothing short of phenomenal. Our teenager has an iPod that would rarely connect with our old unit, but now works great with the ASUS. Don't spend the extra money on the more advanced models unless you are a gadget master, as the technology for the wireless devices lags way behind the routers and it's very likely you will never take advantage of the bleeding edge features on the more expensive models. In other words, for the average home user, this router is all you will need for several years.
customer_reviews.author: TechyNerd

customer_reviews.title: FASTER/EASIER than their support staff knew
customer_reviews.text: RT-N56U router sets itself apart from ordinary routers by offering BitTorrent and FTP server functionality. u may appreciate all of that. I learned 2 love this handsome wireless when i was dumped onto ASUS by charter to get answers for the set-up. CALLING back & forth---fun---NO.i am glad to report that when i gave up & returned to mac there was ASUS ready to take me thru a few steps SNAP---online-& the tvs were also. HINT- registering it there is no category for router---wireless worked. MY macpro the associated disk did not support.
customer_reviews.author: Kasha B.

customer_reviews.title: Heavy users run away
customer_reviews.text: I have had this router since 2014... It works very well. As long as there aren't too many things running. Too many people streaming Netflix? Overheats Too many people on youtube and playing video games? Overheats. Downloading an update while also remoting into an off-site PC? Overheats. I swear two kids on two iPads would overheat this thing. I'm fed up and ordering a new router today.
customer_reviews.author: Cass

customer_reviews.title: Delivers the Speed I expected and more.
customer_reviews.text: I recently switched my Comcast modem to a Motorola 6121. I have the 50 Mbps package from them but was only receiving about 25/10 mbps down/up. I soon realized that the bottleneck was coming from my 3 year old wrt400n linksys router. Soon after switching I am hitting about 65-75/10-15 Mbps down/up on the 5GHz channel. The signal has been steady as a rock. Pros: Easy Set-up Great Media Networking Fast Wireless Speed Aesthetically Pleasing :) Cons: None so far. Tech can be good sometimes. (Will update if I run into any problems)
customer_reviews.author: Nick H.

customer_reviews.title: ASUS Dual-Band Wireless-N 600 Router (RT-N56U)
customer_reviews.text: I have read all kinds of reviews on this Asus RT-N56U router.. All I can say it is the best router that I have ever owned. Works perfect !!! Love the two USB ports for the printer and one to run my back-up hard drive. I have a small house and I get coverage clear into the back bedroom. Streaming video is excellent. No more unplugging the modem and retraining. I have been running it about a month straight and no once have I had to retrain the modem. Very easy to set up . Nothing but good things to say...
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: It was a good router did more then I needed but it was ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this router in Jan 2013. It was a good router did more then I needed but it was good to have the other options if needed. A 6 months ago it began needing a reset every so often. Now 2 years after purchase it needs a reset on a daily or more often basis to get internet access. For ASUS's Flagship router think it's not worth the money if it can't even work reliably for 2 years. I will be going with another more reliable manufacturer's router to replace this.
customer_reviews.author: P. Palfalvi

customer_reviews.title: Returned it for better one....
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a new wireless router because in my neighborhood there was about half a dozen signals... so in theory i needed a better one to be able to decipher the signal. Unfortunately after installing/setup/upgrading the firmware, The Asus router was still receiving interference (live in apt complex). After I moved from apt complex to single family home, the problem went away. But since It is interference prone, i returned it anyways for a competing brand. YMMV, not everyone may have this problem... i'm sure Asus constantly looks at feedback and makes upgades so, with Amazon's great return policy, give the product a try.
customer_reviews.author: Franklin

customer_reviews.title: works with 2 Xbox One Consoles!
customer_reviews.text: This router allows two (2) xbox one consoles (it has multiple console support) in the same home to connect with each other (in games like Dying Light, Destiny, Far Cry 4) without having to change any settings. Be sure to set both xbox one consoles to energy saving mode in the settings (and not instant-on), so that they both have an Open NAT connection (restart each xbox after making this change). The Xbox headphones for chat didn't work the 1st time we played, but they worked every time after that.
customer_reviews.author: Gamera1967

customer_reviews.title: Easy Setup Once Firmware Updated
customer_reviews.text: Once I got this up an running, it has been fast and simple. Initial setup went quick and easy, but I hit a major glitch when I changed either SSID for the wireless: nothing could authenticate. Luckily I knew enough to be able to run a wire to the modem to get a firmware update, which drastically revamped the user interface and fixed the problem. If you purchase this, which I recommend, update the firmware right away! I attached this router to an existing network and it was very easy to switch to Access Point mode to add as the wireless AP.
customer_reviews.author: Srayven

customer_reviews.title: I can however say that it's had very few drops in signal and I'm overall pleased with this router for the
customer_reviews.text: Very reliable router. This has been my wireless router/access point for the last year in a 1100 sq ft apartment. This access point usually has around 3-4 different devices connecting to it at once. My ISP plan is 100 mps down 5 up and I can usually get around the 45 mps mark when I'm in the same room as the router. It has no problems covering the entire apartment, so I have not properly tested its range. I can however say that it's had very few drops in signal and I'm overall pleased with this router for the price
customer_reviews.author: Antonio

customer_reviews.title: ASUS RT-N56U
customer_reviews.text: Strong Wi-Fi throughout the entire house, only had to reset a couple of times and was easy to do because of outside interference. Device is not located in a open area and works great via all the structural walls. Have this device for many years, no major issues with the initial set up and its functions. The only minor issue that I recall was dealing with the setup with the cable company provider/modem, had to contact them to work out a couple of kinks; making the call to cable folks was my only CON.
customer_reviews.author: Nonchaulant

customer_reviews.title: Slightly difficult to setup but A breeze after that
customer_reviews.text: I bought this router to use with my cable internet connection.This router was used but came in the original packing and came with everything i needed. The first time i set it up i couldn't get the wireless to work and eventually had to wait and install the new firmware. After the firmware update everything worked perfectly and as we speak has been running nonstop for 2 weeks. The only problem i have with this router is that it won't show all my files when i attach my external harddrive to it. Other than that small quirk, it is a solid router.
customer_reviews.author: WeirdStudent

customer_reviews.title: this router delivers
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this router on August 30, 2011, and am writing this review about five months later to highly recommend it. I researched routers to be used in a household with one PC, two laptops, a Wii, and a "smart" television with internet capabilities. I found it to be difficult to decide on a router because for every glowing review there was an equally dismissive one. I took a chance on this ASUS Dual Band router and we are extremely satisfied. Every problem we had encountered with our old router (constant need to re-set, slowness, persnicketyness) was now moot. Even nicer was that the set-up was extremely easy.
customer_reviews.author: Amber Lopinsky

customer_reviews.title: Third Purchase
customer_reviews.text: This is the third unit that I've purchased and installed at our church, one for each floor that allows our guests to have WiFi wherever they are. The range is excellent and the browser interface setup quite easy to use. For our purposes our WiFi routers need to be unobtrusive. The ASUS N 600 is small and easily "hidden" without negatively impacting its range or speed. We purchased our first one over a year ago and it has worked flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: RSA

customer_reviews.title: QUESTIONABLE CONNECTIVITY ISSUES
customer_reviews.text: Lots of connectivity issues. So much so that I returned it. Could be me but I had no problems with any other routers that I had to set up before.
customer_reviews.author: D. WILDS

customer_reviews.title: Good router !
customer_reviews.text: I like that the router stands upright and does not take up a lot of room. I don't think I am using the 5GHZ signal at this time. Had some problems with the set-up. Mostly my fault ie: not familiar with some aspects of this. After getting some outside help, router works fine.No problems with router since correctly set up. I-pad, I-phone, Dell desktop and laptop, LG android smart phone all working great! Keep in mind that in order for your devices to accept the new router you may have to select " forget this network " and then connect to it. Even though it shows network is there.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: I got the N-Routing Power!
customer_reviews.text: Im receiving the N-power router signals and let me say, its fantastic! If I wish to surf porn in the garage, I can do that now. If I wish to watch Bruce Lee kick arse in backyard where my pooch takes a liking to roll in the grass, I can do that now. If I wish to listen to Johann Strauss' classic great, the Blue Danube, then I can do so now. You understand where I am going with this, right? This router does it for me. Excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Goat herder

customer_reviews.title: Upgrades of Worthiness
customer_reviews.text: Been having notorious difficulties with my former Linksys 2.4 Ghz Wireless-G router and finally decided to upgrade. Jumped on Asus because I've had motherboards and Graphics Cards from them that really did well. The Router not only provides constant connection, but it finally provides a stable signal on the other side of our 1800 sqf house! Sleek and stylish, without pesky antenna to maneuver and the bonus 5 Ghz signal which several of our devices use! The web-based interface is simple and informative, with several added options for simple bandwidth regulation and network security. Survive five years and get five stars.
customer_reviews.author: Dreadlord Marasoal

customer_reviews.title: Great dual-band router for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Great little dual-band router for the price. Not recommended if you have it connected to a light switch or turn it off at night. It seems to have trouble establishing a network connection when it's powered on/off frequently. I have to go into the administrator mode and toggle the DHCP mode from normal to aggressive mode and then back again. Also, if I leave it on aggressive mode, it interferes with online gaming. My friend has this router as well and says the same thing. When it does work, it's a dream.
customer_reviews.author: G. Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Best Router Ever Bar None
customer_reviews.text: I normally do not review products but felt compelled to in this case -- this is the best router on the market in this price range bar none. In a world of iPads, iTouchs, PSPs, gaming consoles, wirless PCs laptops and printers, Google TV, etc. this router is rock-solid reliable and the fastest I've seen. I tested Linksys and Netgear (junk), not even in the same time galaxy as Asus. Just make sure you're using CAT5e or CAT6 cables/connectors for your wired connections and you'll be enjoying your technology instead of wasting time having connections slow/go up & down/fail, etc. Works perfectly with D-Link G-switches!
customer_reviews.author: YankeesXV

customer_reviews.title: Great Router
customer_reviews.text: I searched high and low for a good Router........................I found it. This is a great router it is well and truly was an improvement on my previous router, however it was very outdated. I love this router because it was easy to set up and I liked the look of it, lets be honest it sits in the middle of my living room it needs to look good. Another great feature is it has both 2.4 and 5 GHz frequency, which if you have a lot of wireless gadgets it makes for less traffic and faster speeds, at least I feel it does. Great product for the price a must have in your home or office.
customer_reviews.author: Jess L

customer_reviews.title: Set it up and forget it!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome! I set it up, changed the default passwords etc and boom it just keeps working away in the background! Someday I will hack it and see if I can run Tomato on it, but for now life is good Update: Jun 2014: For a few months now the 5GHz band is not working as expected. It is extremely slow, often with sites not loading at all. Rebooting and resetting the modem has done nothing. I've restarted my laptop too. There isn't much interference either as there are only 3 other neighbouring networks on this band.(inssider). I'm on the latest firmware (3.0.0.4.374_5656-g8d0a991)
customer_reviews.author: Karthikeyan Ramnath

customer_reviews.title: Fantstic
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this router. It works great with no problems to date. As noted in other reviews the 5 GHz signal does not go as far as the 2.4 GHz signal, but that is expected. This router has very good speed and the distance is not bad. I use this for both wired and wireless connections. It is so much easier to setup than a similar Linksys, but the Linksys seems to have a better range with both at 2.4 GHz. All in all, this is a better router and I am happy with my purchase and would do it again
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Garrison

customer_reviews.title: Free Dynamic DNS service through Asus!
customer_reviews.text: My old router is constraining throughput to 50Mbps upstream and downstream. Bought the Asus because of its fast WAN-to-LAN switching speed. I'm getting 80Mbps+ up and down out of the 100 Mbps offered by my ISP. Pretty happy. Turned wireless off because I don't need that right now. My favorite, unexpected part about this device is that it has its own DDNS service through Asus. Since the dyn.com's free service JUST ENDED, having the free DDNS service via Asus is great! You get a <your-domain>.asuscomm.com address to map your IP to.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Died in 29 days
customer_reviews.text: Bought this unit after reading the good reviews both on Amazon and other review sites. It worked as expected and on the 29th day, started to act up. My devices started to lose connection every few minutes. Got an error message about my IP setting which a number of reviewers on Amazon have also complained about. Thankfully, I was still in the return eligible period with Amazon so returned it for a refund. Not sure if it was the particular unit or a bad batch from Asus. I may move to N-900 since I am still looking for a router with above average reach for my wifi intolernt house.
customer_reviews.author: DP

product_meta.title: Asus Dual-Band Wireless-N600 Gigabit Router (RT-N56U)
product_meta.description:
Asus RT-N56U Wireless-N Router Dual Band Multimedia Ultra Slim Gigabit 802.11a/b/g/n 300Mbps support USB Storage, Print and Media Server (top performance review at smallnetbuilder.com).2-Year parts and labot warranty.

AMAZON.COM
feature_bullets: 2.4 GHz and 5 GHz Concurrent Dual-Band Transmissions up to 600Mbps
Gigabit Ethernet Support: The increasingly popular Gigabit Ethernet allows the download of a full HD movie in about just 5 minutes
One Router for Printing, Scanning and Surfing: Effortless Multitasking for Multiple Users
Interface: 5 Gigabit ports (1x WAN / 4x LAN) and 2x USB 2.0 ports
WAN to LAN throughput over 900Mbps; compatible with all networking standard: IEEE 802.11 a/b/g/n
